description:
Reproduce steps:

1> Create 2 networks with az-hint, and they are in different availability zone hints.

$ neutron net-show net-149
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                   | Value                                |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up          | True                                 |
| availability_zone_hints | zone-149                             |
| availability_zones      | zone-149                             |
| id                      | c1db3273-1e1f-4cd7-acd9-a96f03d3174f |
| name                    | net-149                              |
| port_security_enabled   | True                                 |
| router:external         | False                                |
| shared                  | False                                |
| status                  | ACTIVE                               |
| subnets                 | c039a710-63e5-4b2a-9aa5-33ac10cfe672 |
| tenant_id               | 4a0e924e4f704aa9a735f79e32edb49b     |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+

$ neutron net-show 8bda9ae0-77c9-42fe-bfbf-2612339345a8
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                   | Value                                |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up          | True                                 |
| availability_zone_hints | zone-239                             |
| availability_zones      | zone-239                             |
| id                      | 8bda9ae0-77c9-42fe-bfbf-2612339345a8 |
| name                    | net-239                              |
| port_security_enabled   | True                                 |
| router:external         | False                                |
| shared                  | False                                |
| status                  | ACTIVE                               |
| subnets                 | f935d2f6-0552-4471-a021-5fc3f025113a |
| tenant_id               | 4a0e924e4f704aa9a735f79e32edb49b     |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+

When I boot VM with the command below, it should pick up the network in zone-149

nova boot --flavor 1 --image cirros-0.3.3-x86_64 --availability-zone zone-149 vm-zone-149

But I got error msg: 
ERROR (Conflict): Multiple possible networks found, use a Network ID to be more specific. (HTTP 409) (Request-ID: req-6b01d821-f8a8-4537-b3d1-bf7aebc86a79)
title: After neutron AZ is enabled, nova should add an AZ filter when picking up networks

comments.content:
Reproduce steps:

1> Create 2 networks with az-hint, and they are in different availability zone hints.

$ neutron net-show net-149
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                   | Value                                |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up          | True                                 |
| availability_zone_hints | zone-149                             |
| availability_zones      | zone-149                             |
| id                      | c1db3273-1e1f-4cd7-acd9-a96f03d3174f |
| name                    | net-149                              |
| port_security_enabled   | True                                 |
| router:external         | False                                |
| shared                  | False                                |
| status                  | ACTIVE                               |
| subnets                 | c039a710-63e5-4b2a-9aa5-33ac10cfe672 |
| tenant_id               | 4a0e924e4f704aa9a735f79e32edb49b     |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+

$ neutron net-show 8bda9ae0-77c9-42fe-bfbf-2612339345a8
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                   | Value                                |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up          | True                                 |
| availability_zone_hints | zone-239                             |
| availability_zones      | zone-239                             |
| id                      | 8bda9ae0-77c9-42fe-bfbf-2612339345a8 |
| name                    | net-239                              |
| port_security_enabled   | True                                 |
| router:external         | False                                |
| shared                  | False                                |
| status                  | ACTIVE                               |
| subnets                 | f935d2f6-0552-4471-a021-5fc3f025113a |
| tenant_id               | 4a0e924e4f704aa9a735f79e32edb49b     |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+

When I boot VM with the command below, it should pick up the network in zone-149

nova boot --flavor 1 --image cirros-0.3.3-x86_64 --availability-zone zone-149 vm-zone-149

But I got error msg: 
ERROR (Conflict): Multiple possible networks found, use a Network ID to be more specific. (HTTP 409) (Request-ID: req-6b01d821-f8a8-4537-b3d1-bf7aebc86a79)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yuyangbj

comments.content: please look into host aggregates @ http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/aggregates.html where you can map in the availability zone with net id. This will help allocate resources during instance creation
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~aginwala-f

comments.content: @aginwala, I am not sure why this bug is an invalid bug. I know I can specify the net id manually with the correct availability zone, but per my understanding, in my reported scenario, nova should pick up the right network even though there is not net id specified, because there is only one available network, not two.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yuyangbj

comments.content: @ yangyu  There is AvailabilityZoneFilter by default . Check your nova.conf. It comes by default installation.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~aginwala-f

comments.content: @Yang Yu: since you are making use of the neutron availability zone feature, I am guessing that your installation was built from the master branch. Could you provide more information about the version you are running, like the latest commit? Thank you.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cihand

comments.content:
Cleanup
=======

This bug report has the status "Incomplete" since more than 30 days
and it looks like that there are no open reviews for it. To keep
the bug list sane, I close this bug with "won't fix". This does not
mean that it is not a valid bug report, it's more to acknowledge that
no progress can be expected here anymore. You are still free to push a
new patch for this bug. If you could reproduce it on the current master
code or on a maintained stable branch, please switch it to "Confirmed".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller
